alert.note: Alert for Fergus; Judith Basin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 5:20PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Judith Basin and southern Fergus Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 519 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles west of Hobson to 12 miles northwest of Roundup. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail, along with heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lewistown, Hobson, Moore, Danvers, Forestgrove, Moccasin, Giltedge, Ackley Lake State Park, Glengarry, Heath and Benchland. This includes the following highways... Highway 200 between mile markers 43 and 107. Highway 191 between mile markers 1 and 12, and between mile markers 27 and 42. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall may lead to minor localized flooding of streets, small creeks, and low-lying areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
